data.title: RuPaul on finding your footing
data.meta_description: People still struggling to figure out the next step in their careers could benefit from taking time to get to know themselves, according to RuPaul. He explains why to LinkedIn News.
data.text:
How do you bring your authentic self to work? RuPaul is known around the world for being a fearless advocate of authenticity. The cultural icon recently sat down with LinkedIn News Editor Andrew Seaman for #ConversationsForChange to mark LGBTQ+ #PrideMonth and discuss how people can let go of the roles they think they should be playing to become their truth. RuPaul explains why he’s #OutOnLinkedIn and talks about his experience as an award-winning TV host, actor, author, model, musician and more. He also answers questions from LinkedIn members looking to navigate the sometimes difficult world of work.

As AAPI Heritage Month intersects into Pride Month, I started some writing describing my own experiences as a gay Asian American. It was an emotional journey, and I've been sitting on my reflections, to myself, for a while now. Maybe because of the model minority myth to just shut up, as I have been of my own experiences and feelings over the past decades. Instead I've decided to abandon the stereotype of being quiet that's ascribed to Asians - and to publish this piece. There's so much more work to be done to push for inclusion of AAPIs in America, and in the LGBTQ+ community, and I hope you can be a part of it. Thank you to Jordyn Taylor & Frances Lee at Hearst for convincing me my story was worth being shared. #aapiheritagemonth #pridemonth #diversity #inclusion #stopasianhate #culture #conversationsforchange #outonlinkedin
